title-group.article-title: Tame and Wild Kernels of Quadratic Imaginary Number Fields

abstract.p: For all quadratic imaginary number fields F of discriminant d > -5000, we give the conjectural value of the order of Milnor's group (the tame kernel) K<sub>2</sub>O<sub>F</sub>, where O<sub>F</sub> is the ring of integers of F. Assuming that the order is correct, we determine the structure of the group K<sub>2</sub>O<sub>F</sub> and of its subgroup W<sub>F</sub> (the wild kernel). It turns out that the odd part of the tame kernel is cyclic (with one exception, d = -3387).
